sen.j: 本項京都市南区の町名（きょうとし みなみくのちょうめい）では、同区内に存在する公称町名を一覧化するとともに、その成立時期・成立過程等について概説する。
sen.e: This section on "Town Names in Minami Ward, Kyoto City," lists the official town names in the ward and describes when and how they were established.
This section on "Town names in Minami Ward, Kyoto City" lists official town names in Minami Ward and summarizes the period and process of their establishment.

sen.j: 京都市街地の南方に位置する。
sen.e: Minami ward is located south of the downtown of Kyoto City.
It is located south of Kyoto urban district.

sen.j: 北は右京区と下京区、東から南は東山区と伏見区、西を西京区と向日市に接する。
sen.e: It borders the Wards of Ukyo and Sakyo in the north, the Wards of Higashiyama and Fushimi from the east to the south, and Nishikyo Ward and Muko City in the west.
It borders the Ukyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward in the north, Higashiyama Ward and Fushimi Ward from the east to the south, and Nishikyo Ward and Muko City in the west.

sen.e: It borders the Ukyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward in the north, Higashiyama Ward and Fushimi Ward from the east to the south, and Nishikyo Ward and Muko City in the west.

sen.j: 面積15.78平方キロメートル。
sen.e: It covers the area of 15.78 square kilometers.

sen.j: 2009年3月現在の推計人口は約99,000人。
sen.e: It had an estimated population of about 99,000 in March 2009.

sen.j: 区の北端近くをJR 東海道本線及び東海道・山陽新幹線、八条通が東西に通る。
sen.e: JR Tokaido line, Tokaido and Sanyo Shinkansen and Hachijo-dori Street run from east to west across the ward near the northern edge.

sen.j: JR京都駅の住所は下京区であるが、同駅八条口駅前は南区に属する。
sen.e: While JR Kyoto Station is located in Sakyo Ward, the area around its Hachijo Exit belongs to Minami Ward.
While JR Kyoto Station is located in Shimogyo Ward, the area around its Hachijo Exit belongs to Minami Ward.

sen.j: 区のほぼ中央を南北に京阪国道（国道1号）が通る。
sen.e: Keihan-Kokudo (National Route 1) runs from south to north through the center of the ward.

sen.j: 区の東には鴨川、西には桂川がそれぞれ南流する。
sen.e: Both Kamogawa-river runs in the east and Katsura-gawa River in the west run to the south.

sen.j: 両川は区の南方、伏見区下鳥羽で合流する。
sen.e: They converge in the south, Shimotoba, Fushimi Ward.

sen.j: 区域はこれら両川に挟まれた地区を主体として、桂川西岸の久世地区を含んでいる。
sen.e: The ward mainly covers the area between the two rivers as well as the Kuze area along the western bank of Katsura-gawa River.

sen.j: 区域はすべて平地。
sen.e: It is entirely a flatland.

sen.j: 区成立当時は大部分が農村地帯であった。
sen.e: It was for the most part a rural area when it was established.

sen.j: 現在は住宅地、商業地、工場などの混在する地域となっている。

sen.j: 平安京の南の正門である羅城門、その東西に創建された東寺、西寺は現在の南区内に位置していた。
sen.e: It was within the current Minami Ward that there existed the Rajo-mon Gate which was the southern main gate to Heian-kyo (ancient capital of Japan), as well as the Temples of To-ji and Sai-ji which were build in the east and the west, respectively, of the gate.

sen.j: 区内には東寺（教王護国寺）を除いては、いわゆる観光スポットは少ない。
sen.e: With the exception of the To-ji (Kyoogokoku-ji) Temple, the ward has few sightseeing spots.

sen.j: 当区はもと下京区の一部であったが、昭和30年（1955年）に同区から分区して成立した。
sen.e: It used to be a part of Shimogyo Ward, from which it was separated to become an independent ward in 1955.
It used to be a part of Shimogyo Ward, from which it was separated to become an independent ward in 1955.

sen.j: 区の大部分は明治35年（1902年）、大正7年（1918年）、及び昭和6年（1931年）、旧葛野郡（かどのぐん）及び紀伊郡の村から当時の下京区に編入された区域である。
sen.e: Most of its areas were villages in the former Counties of Kadono and Kii, which were then transferred to the former Shimogyo Ward in 1902, 1918 and 1931.
Most of its areas were villages in the former Counties of Kadono and Kii, which were then transferred to the former Shimogyo Ward in 1902, 1918 and 1931.
Most of its areas were villages in the former Counties of Kadono and Kii, which were then transferred to the former Shimogyo Ward in 1902, 1918 and 1931.

sen.j: 桂川西岸の久世（くぜ）地区はもと乙訓郡久世村で、昭和34年（1959年）に編入された。
sen.e: The Kuze area along the western bank of Katsura-gawa River belonged to Kuze Village, Otokuni County and was incorporated into the ward in 1959.

sen.j: 京都市内の町名には「大原来迎院町」のように旧村名、旧大字名に由来する地名（上記例の場合は「大原」）を冠称するものと、「亀屋町」「菊屋町」のような単独町名とがある。
sen.e: Like 'Ohara Raikoin-cho,' some town names in Kyoto City indicate broad regions ('Ohara' in the case just cited) derived from the names of the former villages or 'Oaza' (administrative units below a town).

The town names of Kyoto City are categorized into those using their former village names or former Oaza (large section of village) such as 'Ohara Raikoin-cho' (in this case, 'Ohara' is the former name) and those using an independent name of a town such as 'Kameya-cho' and 'Kikuya-cho.'
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: The town names of Kyoto City are categorized into those using their former village names or former Oaza (large section of village) such as 'Ohara Raikoin-cho' (in this case, 'Ohara' is the former name) and those using an independent name of a town such as 'Kameya-cho' and 'Kikuya-cho.'

sen.j: 南区の町名は、北部の東海道本線沿いのごく一部を除いて、旧大字名などの地区名を冠した複合町名である。
sen.e: With the exception of few isolated cases along JR Tokaido line in the north, the towns in Minami Ward have compound town names referring to the former names of Oaza, etc.

sen.j: 区内の公称町名の数は、『角川日本地名大辞典 26 京都府』下巻によれば1980年現在269町であった。

sen.j: なお、西中は「西ノ庄」と「中河原」、石嶋は「石原」と「嶋」の合成地名である。
sen.e: Oaza Nishinaka is a compound place name made up of 'Nishinosho' and 'Nakagawara,' while the place name Ishijima is created from the combination of 'Ishihara' and 'Shima.'

The towns that used to belong to Oaza Nishinaka have place names prefixed by 'Nishinosho' or 'Nakagawara,' while those which used to belong to Oaza Ishijima have place names prefixed by 'Ishihara' or 'Shima.'
sen.cmt: 大字亜西中 に属していた町には「西ノ庄」または「中河原」という冠称が付けられている、と解釈し、左記のように変更いたしました。
sen.e: The towns that used to belong to Oaza Nishinaka have place names prefixed by 'Nishinosho' or 'Nakagawara,' while those which used to belong to Oaza Ishijima have place names prefixed by 'Ishihara' or 'Shima.'

sen.j: 大字吉祥院は昭和6年、「吉祥院」を冠称する32町と吉祥院嶋野間詰町の計33町に編成された。
sen.e: In 1931 Oaza Kisshoin was reorganized into 32 towns broadly designated 'Kisshoin' along with Kisshoin Shimanomazume-cho, making a total of 33 towns.
